title: Libertarian Paternalism Explained
description: A 60-second lesson on Libertarian Paternalism Explained.

hook.text: Can a government steer your choices while respecting your freedom? Thaler says yes â€” with careful design.

buildup.text: Libertarian paternalism means structuring choices so the best option is easiest, while keeping all options open.

discovery.text: It's paternalist because it guides. It's libertarian because you can always choose differently.

twist.text: Critics call it manipulation. Supporters call it good design. The debate is far from settled.

climax.text: The UK's Behavioral Insights Team saved billions using this approach on tax, health, and energy policy.

punchline.text: Design the choice. Don't remove it.

quiz.question: What defines libertarian paternalism?
options: Guiding choices while preserving freedom to choose otherwise
Removing all choices to simplify decisions
